September is National Preparedness Month. With wildfires burning across the state and the threat of an earthquake at any moment, it’s important to be prepared in the event a disaster strikes. Please have a plan in place and stay safe. https://twitter.com/Cal_OES/status/1300842224914104320 QT @Cal_OES National Preparedness Month is officially here. Visit our one-stop resource of preparedness tips to help families, neighbors, and communities to get ready for the next disaster.  https://www.caloes.ca.gov:443/ICESite/Pages/National-Preparedness-Month.aspx http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eg2AM12VkAAvtun.jpg

RT @CAL_FIRE If you were evacuated and are returning home, remember to always check with officials first. Confirming through a official source, like your local law enforcement office, will ensure it is safe for you to reenter a previously evacuated area. Learn more at https://www.readyforwildfire.org/post-wildfire/after-a-wildfire/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eg2tRouWoAISHH0.jpg

The United States has surpassed 6 million coronavirus cases. 

We have to do our part in slowing down the spread to protect our communities. Listen to public health experts, practice social distancing, wash your hands, and wear a mask.

California is battling some of the largest wildfires in state history. A hotter and drier climate has led to perfect conditions for massive wildfires.

Climate change is here—and we must fight it at the scale of the crisis. https://twitter.com/CAL_FIRE/status/1300576033498738688 QT @CAL_FIRE This month we have experienced record breaking wildfires. The #SCULightningComplex the 2nd largest fire, the #LNULightningComplex the 3rd largest, and the #AugustComplex the 9th largest fires in California history. https://www.fire.ca.gov/daily-wildfire-report/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EgyS_JaVkAA59-7.jpg
